page.title: 02Brownie holidays in Cumbria
page.content: The disused school at Churchtown has been converted by the Girl Guide Association into holiday accommodation for Guides and Brownies. A dormitory sleeping 18 and a good kitchen has been added to the building. Brownie Packs come with their leaders for a week of well-organised instruction and fun. Each day includes sharing the chores, outdoor activities, competitions and prayers. The children learn to live together in a small community. For many it is the first time they have left their families, and leaders need a sense of humour, energy and tact. Over 1000 Brownies visit the house annually. They pay Â£1.50 per night plus cost of food and electricity. A Guide committee administers the scheme and springcleans the house.
